dt: {bc}a passage through the wing of an airplane or of a missile that is located usually near the leading edge and formed between a main and an auxiliary airfoil for improving flow conditions over the wing so as to increase lift and delay stalling of the wing
{bc}the area on a hockey rink in front of the crease and between the face-off circles
{bc}a place or position in an organization, arrangement, or sequence {bc}{sx|niche||}, {sx|spot||}
{bc}a gap between an end and a tackle in an offensive football line

et: Middle English, the hollow at the base of the throat above the breastbone, from Anglo-French {it}esclot{/it} hoofprint, of Germanic origin; akin to Middle High German {it}slag{/it} blow, hoofprint; probably from its resemblance to a hoofprint {ma}{mat|schlock|}{/ma}
shortdef: a narrow opening or groove : slit, notch

a passage through the wing of an airplane or of a missile that is located usually near the leading edge and formed between a main and an auxiliary airfoil for improving flow conditions over the wing so as to increase lift and delay stalling of the wing

dt: {bc}to place in or assign to a slot

dt.t: her ideas {wi}slot{/wi} neatly into the theory

shortdef: to place in or assign to a slot

dt: {bc}the track of an animal (such as a deer)

shortdef: the track of an animal (such as a deer)

dt: {bc}an electric toy racing car with a pin underneath that fits into a groove on a track for guidance

dt: {bc}a machine whose operation is begun by dropping a coin into a slot

an originally coin-operated gambling machine that pays off according to the matching of symbols on wheels spun by a handle; also : an electronic version of this machine

dt: {bc}to find a place for (someone or something) in a schedule, plan, etc.
